title: Contributing to uklakes
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("robbriers/uklakes", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to uklakes

title: Using the uklakes package
text: UK CEH Lake Portal GIS-based inventory information 40000 lakes across UK. information available lake varies, includes basic physical description, typology information. uklakes package allows retrieve summary lake information lake series lakes, based lake wbid (waterbody id) number. responsibly webscraping information polite package) webpage lake. can also search lake wbid values based strings lake name determine wbids search . Information general physical characteristics, typology, chemistry connectivity metrics retrieved. Biology, land cover water quality information . details information available, see UK Lakes Portal Website, output reference list. Use package implies acceptance Terms Use available .

title: Using the uklakes package
text: search_lakes function allows search listing lakes within portal, based string provided. return dataframe containing name wbid number lakes contain (full partial match, case sensitive) string provided. text: UK CEH Lake Portal GIS-based inventory information 40000 lakes across UK. information available lake varies, includes basic physical description, typology information. uklakes package allows retrieve summary lake information lake series lakes, based lake wbid (waterbody id) number. responsibly webscraping information (using polite package) webpage lake. can also search lake wbid values based strings lake name determine wbids search . Information general physical characteristics, typology, chemistry connectivity metrics retrieved. Biology, Land cover water quality information . details information available, see UK Lakes Portal Website, output reference list. Use package implies acceptance Terms Use available .

title: Retrieves Lake Information from UK CEH Lakes Portal
text: can install current version uklakes GitHub :

title: Retrieves Lake Information from UK CEH Lakes Portal
text: two functions package. search_lakes function allows search lake wbid numbers lakes matching (partial full matches, case sensitive) string provided. second function (get_lake_info) retrieves available information lake lakes specified (wbid numbers). can retrieve single lake (single wbid value), series (wbid numbers separated commas), sequence wbids (specified normal R sequence manner, .e. 45:48), vector wbids (either standalone vector column df e.g. wbid column output search_lakes combination . See examples . information obtained responsibly webscraping lake information webpages. package respects rate limit repeat request values specified robots.txt file UK CEH Lakes Portal pages (currently 1 request per 5 seconds maximum 3 attempts) reports progress console. lakes fails retrieve (either incorrect wbids reasons) reported end process. resultant output different number columns depending information available lakes specified, giving NA values columns data absent. full listing possible output columns given output reference list
code: library(uklakes) search_lakes("Tarn") # 140 lakes with 'Tarn' in the name in the portal database  search_lakes("Leven") # two Loch Levens and one Loch of Levenwick # Loch Lomond get_lake_info(24447)  # some small lakes in Shetland get_lake_info(4, 6, 9)  # a series of small lakes in Shetland get_lake_info(1232:1238)  # the first 5 Tarns in the database tarns <- search_lakes("Tarn") get_lake_info(tarns$wbid[1:5])

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # get information for Loch Lomond and Loch Katrine get_lake_info(24447, 24531)  # get lake information for a set of lakes including a sequence get_lake_info(4, 5, 6, 34:37)  # can also pass in the wbid column from the output of search_lakes tarn_list <- search_lakes("Tarn") # just retrieve the first 5 lakes get_lake_info(tarn_list$wbid[1:5]) } # }
